---
title: Uninstalling the agent
tabs: ['English', 'Deutsch', 'Espanol']
description: None
---

<PageDescription>

This is an optional section, you will cmpletly remove the agent from the IBM Edge Application Manager Exchange and from your device.

</PageDescription>

## Remove the Agent from the Exchange

The following command should give you a list of your devices

```bash
hzn exchange node list
```

To remove your device from the exchange
1. Using hzn unregister

```bash
hzn unregister -rDf
```

<InlineNotification kind="info">

**Note:** the `-r` flag removes this node resource from the Horizon exchange (because you no longer want to use this node with Horizon), the -D flag removes all the previous registration information, the `-f` forces to skip the 'are you sure?' prompt. 

</InlineNotification>

<InlineNotification kind="warning">

**Warning:** Do not use the -D flag on a registered device.

</InlineNotification>

<Accordion>
  <AccordionItem title="hzn unregister -rDf output">

```bash
$ hzn unregister -rDf
Backing up eventlogs...
Saved eventlog into file /tmp/eventlogs_bkp_2021-05-06T09:35:29Z.txt
The node is not registered.
Starting external deep clean ...
Deleting local horizon DB...
Deleting service containers...
Starting horizon...
```

  </AccordionItem>
</Accordion>

2. Using hzn exchange
```bash
hzn exchange node remove <your-device>
```

<InlineNotification kind="warning">

**Warning:** Do not use the above command on a registered device.

</InlineNotification>

## Uninstalling the horizon agent and cli from your device

Stop the horizon agent by issuing


```bash
systemctl stop horizon
```

Uninstall the packages with the following command

<Tabs>

<Tab label="RHEL">

```bash
sudo yum remove --purge horizon horizon-cli
```

</Tab>

<Tab label="Raspian/Ubuntu">

```bash
sudo apt-get remove --purge horizon horizon-cli
```

</Tab>

<Tab label="macOS">

With the following command you remove the horizion cli from your Mac 

Check the installation directory
```bash
sudo pkgutil --pkg-info com.github.open-horizon.pkg.horizon-cli
```

Remove the files the installation directory (/Users/Shared/horizon-cli)

Remove the pkg
```bash
sudo pkgutil --forget com.github.open-horizon.pkg.horizon-cli
```

</Tab>

</Tabs>
